verses.verse: ((1 David prophesieth of the power and everlasting kingdom given to Christ, 4 and of his Priesthood, which should put an end to the Priesthood of Levi.) ) The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou at my right hand, until I make thine enemies thy footstool.

The Lord shall send the rod of thy power out of (And thence it shalt stretch through all the world: and this power chiefly standeth in the preaching of his word.) Zion: be thou ruler in the midst of thine enemies.

Thy people shall come willingly at the time of assembling (By the word thy people shall be assembled into thy Church whose increase shall be so abundant and wonderous as the drops of the water.) thine army in holy beauty: the youth of thy womb shall be as the morning dew.

The Lord sware, and will not repent, Thou art a Priest forever, after the order of (As Melchizedek the figure of Christ was both a King and Priest, so this effect cannot be accomplished on any king save only Christ, Heb. 7:26.) Melchizedek.
The Lord that is at thy right hand, shall wound kings in the day of his wrath.
He shall be judge among the heathen: he shall fill all with dead bodies, and smite the (No power shall be able to resist him.) head over great countries.

He shall (Under this similitude of a captain that is so greedy to destroy his enemies, that he will not scarce drink by the way, he showeth how God will destroy his enemies.) drink of the brook in the way: therefore shall he lift up his head.
